Question: A 1,200-pound horse eats about seven times it's own weight each year.
The average dog requires more food in proportion to its size than a human baby or a cat.
A cat has 32 muscles in each ear.
A cat's jaws can move sideways.
A chameleon's tongue is three times the length of its body.
A chimpanzee can learn to recognize itself in a mirror, but monkeys can't.
A cow gives nearly 200,000 glasses of milk in her lifetime.
A Holstein cow's spots are like a fingerprint or snowflake. No two cows have exactly the same pattern of spots.
